content.question:
Question 4 asks you to identify a pitch pattern that is played. You will have ten seconds to read the choices, and then you will hear the musical example played twice, with a brief pause between playings. Now listen to the music for Question 4 and identify the pitch pattern that is played.

Which of the following is played?

choices.label: A three-measure melody in bass clef. The time signature is three-four. The notes are half note A2, quarter C3, dotted quarter D3, eighth C3, quarter B2, and dotted half A2.
A three-measure melody in bass clef, time signature three-four. The notes are half note A2, quarter C3, dotted quarter D3, eighth C3, quarter B-flat 2, and dotted half A2.
A three-measure melody in bass clef, time signature three-four. The notes are half note A2, quarter C-sharp 3, dotted quarter D3, eighth C3, quarter B-flat 2, and dotted half A2.
A three-measure melody in bass clef, time signature three-four. The notes are half note A2, quarter C-sharp 3, dotted quarter D3, eighth C-sharp 3, quarter B2, and dotted half A2.

content.answer: A three-measure melody in bass clef, time signature three-four. The notes are half note A2, quarter C-sharp 3, dotted quarter D3, eighth C3, quarter B-flat 2, and dotted half A2.
